pullRequest.body: This deletes a few deprecated lemmas, allowing us to clean up some imports.

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`- map_multiset_prod`
`-- map_finsupp_prod`
`-- map_finsupp_sum`
`-- map_prod`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This does what it says on the tin. It sets a different precedent, though: all these lemmas have just been deprecated for *five* months; so far, deprecation removals were after twelve, nine or sometimes six months. I'd like a maintainer to weigh in.
(There is some actual cost to keeping them, which is why this has some merit. But the trade-off should be considered.)
maintainer delegate?

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12104408603/job/33747782130)

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.

This does what it says on the tin. It sets a different precedent, though: all these lemmas have just been deprecated for *five* months; so far, deprecation removals were after twelve, nine or sometimes six months. I'd like a maintainer to weigh in.
(There is some actual cost to keeping them, which is why this has some merit. But the trade-off should be considered.)
